description: Core data models and interfaces for a Tetris game, including coordinates, tetromino types, rotations, piece states, board state management, and shape definitions, suitable for unit testing and platform-agnostic logic.

classes.name: Coord
classes.description: A simple data class representing a 2D coordinate with utility addition operator.

classes.name: TetrominoType
classes.description: Enumeration of the seven standard Tetris tetromino types.

classes.name: Rotation
classes.description: Enumeration representing the four rotation states of Tetris pieces with methods to get clockwise and counter-clockwise rotations.

classes.name: PieceState
classes.description: Data class representing the current state of a tetromino piece, including type, rotation, and origin; with method to compute occupied blocks.

classes.name: BoardCell
classes.description: Represents a single cell in the game board, indicating if it is filled and its tetromino type if filled.

classes.name: BoardState
classes.description: Immutable class representing the entire game board state, providing methods to access and modify cells, bounds check, and collision detection.

classes.name: TetrominoShapes
classes.description: Internal object defining the block layouts for each tetromino type and rotation, following SRS conventions.

methods.name: blocks
methods.description: Returns the list of relative block coordinates for a given tetromino type and rotation.

methods.name: cw
methods.description: Returns the next rotation state when rotating clockwise.

methods.name: ccw
methods.description: Returns the next rotation state when rotating counter-clockwise.

methods.name: kicks
methods.description: Provides wall kick offsets for rotating a tetromino from one rotation state to another according to SRS.
